comments.text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:8.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/8.0
Build ID: 20111104165243

Steps to reproduce:

Downloaded a file with Firefox 8.0.


Actual results:

The Downloads window never shows the domain from which it's downloading from. Only when a download is finished the domain is shown.


Expected results:

When a download is in progress, the domain should be shown and there should be a (+) icon that, when clicked, shows the full URL of the file.

The download manager of Firefox still does not show the source of an active download.
How the others do: 
- Opera (tooltip)
- Chrome (interface, along with file name, speed etc)
I haven't tested IE and Safari.

That's why I just marked as [parity-chrome] and [parity-opera] in whiteboard.
